name: Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach

reviews.text: Best thing about this hotel is location. Many nice bars and restaurants only few steps away from the hotel door not to mention the beach. Nice friendly staff great food very very clean and new. I will not stay any other place next time I'm in Dubai.
reviews.title: Totally recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 438 rooms; 24 sunbeds. Sunbeds full all the time, and this was even before the hotel was finished, and some rooms not in use.
reviews.title: Too few sunbeds

reviews.text: The best part of Dubai was this hotel. There was always plenty of staff throughout the hotel to take care of anything. Our front desk clerk must have heard that we were there to celebrate a birthday and the next day a cake, flowers and card from the manager was in our room. Get the breakfast option unless you're hooked on Starbucks which is just a block away. The breakfast is plentiful and excellent. Service is top notch on every level. Everyone greets you and is outgoing. The pool bar is open 24/7 and we had a great late night snack / dinner under the stars. The pool area is nice but I agree not large enough for the amount of guests. Rooms were wonderful, spotless. Bed heavenly. The fitness area is very good with great machines. The spa is for women only! Can't figure that one out. Overall, if I came back to Dubai (doubtful, way too many nicer destinations), I'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at the Sofitel on Jumeirah Beach, and we really want to stay here again !
reviews.title: Great location and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a luxury room with balcony and view right out to the beach (and overlooking the parkinglot) - and experienced no problem with noise from the traffic below.
reviews.title: Overall rating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on two separate occasions whilst in transit to Oman. The hotel itself looks good and the staff in the main are charming. We ate in the Italian restauarant (Rococo) and had an excellent meal.
reviews.title: Teething problems?

reviews.text: The hotel is too noisy for me. On our second stay we could hear building work in the day and the noise from the traffic at night was loud. On our first stay we caught the tail end of the shopping festival and there was a fairground close to the hotel. Again, too loud.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given that the hotel is opening slowly I suppose a few teething problems are to be expected. However, the attitude of the person who checked us in the first time was very very poor.
reviews.title: Not up to speed with the competition
great hotel
reviews.text: We also had a problem on our second visit with payment. We only use debit cards and are quite happy for hotels to take money from these in advance. indeed, on our first stay we merrily spent money in the bars and restaurants with no problem (as is the case wherever we stay). On our second visit however we ate out and returned to the bar for a glass of wine. We signed with our room number and thought no more of it. Later that night (21.30) we received a phone call saying that this was a problem and could someone come to the room to take payment on a card (the bill was c£20). This meant that at 21.50 two members of staff came to our room with a card machine. I can't say I care for the insinuation. The card machine didn't work and the whole thing left us decidedly unimpressed.
Dubai is a crowded market and Sofitel is going to have to try considerably harder than this.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with attentive staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Several of my friends marvel about the size of the hotel rooms in Dubai. We were therefore disappointed to get a fairly small room with insufficient cupboard space. We had specifically requested twin beds and got a single bed. When we complained at the reception, the girl said "but we gave you a bed for three people". It was indeed a king size bed but as the mattress is fairly soft (it would have been lovely in a single bed), we still disturbed each other when turning over. The air conditioning is very noisy. The view onto the sea was fine but there is a road in-between and before you get to the public beach, you have to cross a large parking area. Otherwise, the situation is fine, right where all the restaurants are. The bathroom is very nice, the entrance hall sumptuous. However, I have never seen a hotel where so much staff is just standing around - very friendly and helpful but what do they need all these people for? As mentioned by other guests, the pool area is much too small and squatted all day by the same people. Breakfast is a great experience though you can get neither butter nor milk from the buffet - you have to ask for it and then it is brought to your table. In the meantime, you wait. As this is a tower hotel, you often have to wait a long time for a lift. In summary, a fairly pleasant stay but next time I would go to a hotel with a private beach, with larger rooms and only a few floors.
reviews.title: Not quite what we expected

reviews.text: We were stranded in Dubai during the volcano eruption in Iceland and enjoyed four great days there. It's top in every category. It helps that it is brand new. Nice service!
reviews.title: Great place!!

reviews.text: I highly recommend this newly built hotel. Excellent service from start to finish - the staff were incredibly friendly (the only issue was not receiving a call back from the concierge when asked to confirm a flight).
reviews.title: A Brilliant Stay

reviews.text: I stayed on the 24th floor (highest available as floors 25-31 were not yet open) in a corner unit facing the ocean. One word: wow.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was new, clean and well-appointed. Complimentary slippers and wireless internet were a plus. The king-sized bed was quite firm, but the pillows and duvet were comfy. The bathroom was well-done with a rainfall shower and deep soaker tub with French window doors that open up for a view of the ocean. The highlight though is the balcony - the beach/ocean and an unobstructed view of Atlantis at the Palms and the Walk in Dubai Marina.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying in several other 5* beach hotels in Dubai I was a little disappointed. The hotel itself is separated by a road to the beach. The beach view room was extremely noisy (with a fairground blaring music from the car park below) Early nights were not really an option. Furthermore we had several days where the room was not made up by 15:00 and for two consequtive days my afternoon nap was disturbed by banging upstairs.Getting a bed by the pool is not guaranteed as the sun longe area is relatively small.
reviews.title: Good hotel but not as good as other 5* beach hotels in Dubai

reviews.text: On the positive, the hotels staff were extremely friendly and the rooms are of decent size and nicely furnished. The Sofitel trademark is the comfortable beds and this was certainly the case in this hotel. The hotel is very close to may other restaurants and central for shopping etc. I would stay here again on business but sadly have been spoiled by previous experiences at other 5* beach hotels in Dubai to return for a holiday. On this occasion I came for relaxation and didn't get it.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic

reviews.text: The hotel was brilliant and absolutely beautiful. The room was magnificient, the bath with the opening double doors was a favourite. The bed was so big that both of us stretched out and still couldnt touch each other. The staff in the hotel were fabulous and couldnt do enough to help us. One night they even went and got us slippers to wear while we ate dinner in the restaurant as we had sore feet after shopping. I did not need to ask for this they just did it. The staff called us by name every morning when we went to the gym and the personal trainer was always on hand to help us out. He was based in the gym which I thought was fantastic.. The food was 5 star plus and always plenty of it. I will definetly be going back to this hotel as it was magical.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.text: Only one small gripe - was the sun beds. There just wasnt enough of them and for people for Scotland who never see the sun it is quite important. I was say this needs to be sorted out as many people just didnt get a lounger and a few people were less than happy.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. Best hotel I have ever stayed in. The service is beyond fantastic, the staff can not do enough for you. Food is of a very high quality and the rooms are just the best. My only little moan would be the lack of sunloungers poolside, there is only around 20 beds and the hotel hold up to 400 people. All in all am amazing experince and I'd be a very luckly girl if I ever got the chance to go back.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel in a fantastic location

description: Luxury beachfront hotel combining French spirit with Dubai’s most appealing features: waterfront location, sea-view and direct access to The Walk, the city’s stylish beachside promenade and outdoor shopping area. 35 Minutes from Dubai International Airport, close to Dubai Media City, Jebel Ali Free Zone, two of Dubai’s biggest shopping malls, and three prestigious golf clubs. Leisure facilities: Beauty Salon, Infini-pool, Health Club, Sauna and Steam room. Two restaurants and three lounges present truly international flavors. A dedicated Inspired Meetings team meets the needs of business travellers. Free wi-fi and a separate meetings floor ensure a satisfactory business operation.
